tool.name: Chromosome Diagram

param.name: per_page
param.label: Chromosomes per page?
param.help: For everything on one page, leave blank or use zero. If set to one, larger fonts are used.

param.name: gaps
param.label: Show NNNN regions of at least this length
param.help: If you don't want to show such gaps, leave blank or use zero

tool.help:
**What it does**
Draws a 'Chromosome Diagram', with one vertical bar for each sequence in the reference FASTA file which is expected to contain one sequence per chromosome or psuedo molecule, annotated with the positions and captions given in the tabular annotation file.
The same vertical scale is used for all the chromosomes (even when drawn of different pages), based fitting the longest chromosome on a page.
The annotation file should contain one line per feature to show. The features will be added in the order given, so if there are overlaps the later features will be on top of the earlier features.
**Citations**
This tool uses the Biopython and ReportLab libraries to draw the diagram. If you use this tool in scientific work leading to a publication, please cite the Biopython application note:
Cock et al 2009. Biopython: freely available Python tools for computational molecular biology and bioinformatics. Bioinformatics 25(11) 1422-3. http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btp163 pmid:19304878.
